subject: Re: How to skip a test case and go to next one at runtime....Plz suggest if ther's any other way !!!
msgSnippet: Hi David, I m currently using Junit 3.8
messageBody:
Hi David,

I'm currently using Junit 3.8

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>
> sumeshbadge,
>
> Are you using JUnit 3 style, or JUnit 4 style? The answer depends on
> that. Thanks,
>
> David Saff
>
> On Tue, Oct 12, 2010 at 8:32 AM, sumeshbadge <sumeshbadge@...> wrote:
> > Hi,
> >
> > I want to skip a test case and go to the next one based on some conditions. For ex:
> >
> > testcase1{
> > // some condition
> > }
> >
> > testcase2{
> > }
> >
> > What I exactly want is; while executing testcase1() if "some condition" fails (or is not meet) then go to next test case i.e testcase2(). Is there any way to achieve this???
> > Please reply if you have any thoughts!!!
> >
> >
> >
> > ------------------------------------
> >
> > Yahoo! Groups Links
> >
> >
> >
> >
>
